website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive smart TV in a versatile size that proves you don't need a huge screen to have an enjoyable viewing experience.
pros: Features a mid-sized 43-inch screen that's practical for small to medium-size rooms
Affordable price won't stress your budget too much
Simple to set up and start streaming thanks to the built-in Roku technology
HDR and 4K combine to deliver excellent picture quality and gaming action
cons: Some TVs arrived with broken screens

website_summaries.verdict: Although the image quality is just "good enough," the S425 series is still an excellent choice for budget buyers focused on streaming and simplicity.
pros: The TCL S425 series is one of the least expensive smart TVs you can buy
Roku TV delivers the best smart TV experience on the market, with a simple, responsive user interface, thousands of apps and constant feature upgrades
cons: It has worse picture than Vizio's E series TVs
4K resolution and HDR don't deliver a substantial improvement in image quality

customer_reviews.title: Check it, by plugging it in, before your lesd than 30 day return window time.
customer_reviews.text: Looked fine until it was plugged in and turned on.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Cline

customer_reviews.title: Nice picture but the WiFi is garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this TV as a replacement for a old TV I had in my bedroom. At first it seemed to work fine and the picture quality is great. After the first day or two it started not being able to connect to my WiFi. It constantly loses connection to the WiFi and it is so bad you can’t even stream anything without losing connection. I can connect fine with any other device in my household standing right next to this TV.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 30 mins
customer_reviews.text: Loved the TV for the 30 mins that it worked. Then it totally shut down and went to a dark blue screen. I called the manufacturer and our options were to return the TV and get it repaired, return the TV and get a new one or return the TV and get our money back. I'm choosing to get our money back. Amazon has been great to deal with, the TV is crap though.
customer_reviews.author: Regina D

customer_reviews.title: Junk breaks
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after one day. The manufacturer was rude and not helpful. I’m returning it. I will never buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Lorene Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Roku will not reveal the resolution of any program being watched.
customer_reviews.text: How do I know I am watching 4K, 1080 or 720p on my TCL? I can't on-screen monitor/ verify / check the resolution of the cable provider, local broadcaster, or app program. I was just "reassured" by a Roku CSR that while I can never verify the display resolution I should have no concerns because the TCL automatically adjusts to whatever is sent out. Seriously? This is my first and last TCL. Now I know why my Vizio, Samsung, Amazon, Fire Cube and, Apple TVs are not Rokus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked for only one day - Big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this TV and had great hoped for it to work well for me. But it did not. The second day it froze on the antenna setting and kept turning off and on again. I went through the trouble shooting with the expert at Amazon who consulted the TCL rep as well. The TCL rep agreed that this was a defective piece and I bundled it up and took it to UPS. Hours of effort wasted for nothing. I will not recommend this TV
customer_reviews.author: Kazim

customer_reviews.title: Too good to be true!  Don’t waste your $$.
customer_reviews.text: I was lured in by the cheap price of this TV.... Not worth it!! I’ve had it less than a week and had to reset to factory settings 3 times already. Tv functionality keeps freezing. And if I watch the TV for too long, the screen goes bonkers (see picture). Also, the remote doesn’t work unless it is pointed EXACTLY at the bottom center of the TV where the receiver is — it can’t even be a little off in any direction. Never experienced a TV this bad. There is a reason it was only $329... should have been only $32.99!!!
customer_reviews.author: SarahA

customer_reviews.title: If you watch mainly broadcast TV, don't buy this TV
customer_reviews.text: This TV is great for streaming, but very irritating for broadcast channels. First, to download my channels I could not use the "cable" option even though I have a cable. Through trial and error and much frustration, I finally tried "antenna" and that worked even though I do not have an antenna. Second and most irritating is that there are no numbers on the remote and you must use the up and down arrows to change the channel. Although there is a "favorites" option and an "enable cable" choice, it doesn't work for broadcast channels. Very young people must have designed this TV. I would not buy it again, nor would I recommend it for people who enjoy broadcast TV.
customer_reviews.author: elifair

customer_reviews.title: Bait and Switch
customer_reviews.text: “Note: Roku does not charge for activation or support.” This is a lie!!! Upon setup, it fails and you have to call 1-855-256-4555. Then, you have to setup a Roku account (provide email). Eventually, the outsourced operator explains you need to pay $89.99 for a 5 year Roku subscription or $129.99 for a Lifetime Roku subscription. You cannot decline and access your tv in anyway for local channels or even subscriptions you already have (Netflix, Hulu, etc.). So add $90-$130 to the listed price. This is fraudulent and in accurate product description. We are returning our tv, but claims should be filed for anyone swindled into paying for this bait and switch.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel R

customer_reviews.title: Half the screen is screwed up upon receiving
customer_reviews.text: TV is screwed up, half the screen is jacked upon receiving. very poor Amazon performance day not only is the TV I receive today completely screwed up and I have to wait for another one....but the other product is simple bike bag to carry your dog in was missing two of the parts required. Amazon struck out twice today, going to Walmart is looking better and better every day. Unbelievable what a pain in the a**
customer_reviews.author: eudaman

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it!
customer_reviews.text: One star only because no stars isn’t an option. After carefully setting up my new tv, I turned it on to nothing but cracks. The glass was not broken...something inside was. I called the seller who suggested getting another one from the manufacturer in 10 days. Nope. Went through the hassle of reboxing and taking to UPS for a return. Amazon refunded my money immediately. Stopped at Walmart on the way home and got the same model that works perfectly. Lesson learned...don’t buy TVs online 😂
customer_reviews.author: flamingo chick

customer_reviews.title: Wall Mount you say?!  I double dog dare you!
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this TV to a pre-existing mount for another 50" 4k that went out. Jokes on me, this TVs VESA mounting points are not centered on the unit!? I have hung multiple TVs from several other manufacturers and they without exception have mounting points that align roughly with the center mass of the unit. Break out the drill boys and girls, this one mounts different. P.S. The speakers blows.
customer_reviews.author: moe

customer_reviews.title: Honesty
customer_reviews.text: I will start out with what I disliked. Yesterday I received my new 55" TCL ROKU TV. When I used the activation code provided, it didn't work and was prompted to call customer service. I called and they would not activate my tv unless I paid a one time fee of $100.00. TV is worthless if u can't use it. I complained as this fee was never disclosed to me until TV was setting in my home. It did not help. They had me. I felt ripped off big time. After paying them another 100.00$ my tv works beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: SJG

customer_reviews.title: Better than Expected
customer_reviews.text: Had for a week now. Way better than I expected for this amazing price. Don't get me wrong, I'm sure if you buy an expensive name brand 4k tv that costs 3x as much, the colors will be a little better, maybe an accelerated refresh rate, louder speakers, etc, but this TV was well worth it. It is 4k HDR 60Hz, AND is a smart TV with Roku enabled. Name brand competitors tend to be $600+ for this quality and size 4k smart TV. Sound quality is good as well, especially just for casual use. 5 stars in terms of quality for the price. Happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kalib

customer_reviews.title: Roku has the ability to pull your paid channels without warning
customer_reviews.text: I really liked roku in my tv, Until I found out they can remotely pull paid channels from your system. Just remove it out of the blue. No warning. A channel you paid for. So you have no real control over your channels. This seems like a huge flaw. I would not recommend devices with roku in it anymore. This is just bad practice. You pay for a channel, or hope you have that channel that you use a lot and one day its just gone.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: This TV is cheap and you can tell. The picture is mediocre at best. We immediately started having problems with it. Randomly, when we turned on the TV, the screen would be blank and black. We had to call customer service. They told me an on-site technician would call me to schedule an appointment. What a joke!!! He was incredibly flaky and unprofessional. He claimed that he called me and left messages but never did. I was left with no choice but to return it. I'm so happy I did. I ended up buying a Samsung which is a thousand times better.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A.

customer_reviews.title: Mine wasn’t new, appears to be open box, lacking remote and power cord.
customer_reviews.text: TV arrived in a brown TCL box, different than the white TCL box I’m used to seeing. After unboxing the TV I try locating the feet and find that not only the feet are missing but also the remote, power cord and any sort of documentation. It has every appearance of being an open box special without the open box price. I called TCL and they said someone would contact me within 24 hours after they review my case. it has been more than 24 hours and no reply. I think I would have been better off buying refurbished than this supposedly new TV.
customer_reviews.author: L. Burnham

customer_reviews.title: Xbox users and HDR.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the price. You need to force it to use hdmi 2.0 via the input settings for Xbox to be able to use HDR. Settings > TV inputs > whatever your Xbox input is > HDMI mode And select 2.0. Don’t leave it in auto or the Xbox won’t recognize the capabilities correctly. Other than that, good buy.
customer_reviews.author: MonkeyWrench

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Worked flawlessly. Menus are well designed. Easy to set up. Picture quality is fantastic. The viewing angle is pretty narrow. You will get some washout when viewed off center. My only concern was with the mounting points for the wall bracket. They are very narrow. Best if you use a wall mount with a flat plate that screws to the back. The mount I’m using has two vertical bars. It’s not very steady. Again, for the price of the tv you can’t beat it! Hopefully it lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware great TV but...
customer_reviews.text: First I really like the TV. Great picture and sound. However there is a catch they do not tell you about. If you do not have a a Roku account you can't turn on the TV. Free activation only applies if you already have an account. Very sneaky way to do business if you ask me. My black Friday deal cost me $130 more than I anticipated. 😕😒😡
customer_reviews.author: Donna M Winsloe

customer_reviews.title: WiFi doesn’t connect
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this TV and omg I am having hard time connecting my WiFi every time I try to watch something. It takes forever to connect and when it does connection goes in and out. I have checked my WiFi it’s great. It works w all other divices in the house
customer_reviews.author: Mashuka Akter

customer_reviews.title: No Channel 4 Over The Air
customer_reviews.text: Channel 4 (and probably Channel 3) is not available via antenna connection. All other local channels work. Ch 4 works on an older TV, which has 65 additional feet of coax. The set-up allows Ch 3&4 to be reserved for VCR, but no matter how you set it, no Ch 4. So now I own a brand new TV, but can't get a local station. Haven't decided whether to return it, but this major malfunction should be known by all potential buyers.
customer_reviews.author: Two Dogs

customer_reviews.title: Damaged Screen
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for a relative and after setting up it became clear the lower portion of the screen was damaged in two locations as noted in the picture. Amazon quickly replaced it but the start-up guide that should have come with the new TV was missing from the box and the ziplock bag that contained it and other components was open, which makes me think they replaced the new TV with a refurbished one. I am going to have to contact Amazon about that. I will say that the TV picture was great, other than the damage, and was easy to set up. Using the Roku was simple.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R Gagne

customer_reviews.title: Amazon replaced!
customer_reviews.text: When the TV arrived I went to assemble it. The stand already had a small screw in the hole used to attach the stand to the TV. I could not remove this screw so I couldn't attach the stand. A call to the manufacturer was no help so Amazon is making me return the whole TV and shipping me a replacement! What a waste when all I need is just one side of the stand replaced.
customer_reviews.author: f

customer_reviews.title: do not buy
customer_reviews.text: The tv it self is very good but while trying to set it up Roku help number tried to get me to sign up for all the gadgets that come's with it. I am not tech smart so they had me going for awhile thinking I was going to have to pay for all the accessories. When I told them I was going to get my cable provider help me they knew the gig was up. Very deceptive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For $800 this is one of the best deals anywhere
customer_reviews.text: $800. 75 inches. 4K HDR. The screen is so big if you are sitting close enough you have to move your eyeballs left to right to take it all in. Great picture. Great color. Great clarity. Easy to set up. My gamer kid-college student home for the summer stayed home tonight because she got this new TV today and we set it up at 8pm. Re-read that last sentence. She has nothing but good to say about it in the last 2 1/2 hours. Enough so, that she cancelled plans to hang out with this television. Pretty amazing approval in that act on her part. I'm happy I didn't have to spend $2600 to get the same level of satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Brown

customer_reviews.title: The adage "You get what you pay for" applies here.
customer_reviews.text: Chose this TV because we have a Roku already and like its functionality, and it's price point is just right. Well, you get what you pay for. It repeatedly crashed. There was no rhyme or reason to why it would crash. Sometimes right in the middle of a Netflix show, sometimes when openeing an app, sometimes it would crash *during* the power on sequence, and fail to even boot. And this was when it actually turned on at all. A lot of the time, I had to reset it 10 or 15 times (not exaggerating) to get it to even turn on. I advise looking elsewhere. TCL clearly isn't quality checking these.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Staros

customer_reviews.title: Great tv, needs better options.
customer_reviews.text: The only two issues I have with this tv is the constant advertising of movies or shows in the main menu and on the screen saver. I don’t want to see that, and the whole mirror share option. Make sure to turn that option off out of the box because your neighbors might try to stream inappropriate things on your tv. I kept waking up to my tv being on in the middle of the night because my neighbors were trying to use mirror stream. The tv needs better options for keeping outside people from controlling your tv.
customer_reviews.author: The Paulson’s

customer_reviews.title: White power indicator light
customer_reviews.text: For anyone with an issue on the white power light staying on follow the steps below: Press the HOME button on your TCL remote. On the left side of the screen, select the SETTINGS option and press OK. Select the SYSTEM option and press OK. Go to POWER and press OK. Select STANDBY LED and press OK. Here you have the option of turning this light on or off.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: You almost get what you paid for
customer_reviews.text: The price clearly jumps out as a selling point. A fantastic value. Picture quality blows almost everything in its class away. Roku software is good and lacks some bells and whistles in exchange for stability and flexibility. Audio quality is garbage, but that is true of any lightweight tv. Quality control is sub par. My set came with a wrinkle in the screen that looks like a glaring spot. Not sure if I can get over it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Zaki

customer_reviews.title: Missing important items from the box.
customer_reviews.text: Item came without remote control, user manual, power cord or feet. Edit: After owning for about a week now, I find it very annoying to have to select the input everytime I turn the tv on. Even though I've deleted all the other inputs off the main screen, there's no way to automate this so far. Turn on the tv, select the already wanted input, wait for it to tune it in and go. This pre select screen gives the tv a chance to force ads on you, might be the reason for the cheaper price. In the end it's a nice tv.mine seems to be an anomaly in that it shipped with nothing but the tv.
customer_reviews.author: DougTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 5 weeks
customer_reviews.text: This tv was great, for the 5 weeks that it actually worked. Now the picture won’t turn on, and TCL says it’s a Roku problem and Roku says it’s a TCL problem. Now the picture is a blackish blue screen of death, after days of attempting factory resets I can now hear sound, but still no picture. Which is really great during a self-quarantine and pandemic. Do not order this. Apparently this is a really big problem that happens a lot. I was able to find lots of YouTube videos and tried all the work around a before calling both Roku and TCL. Just, buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Larissa Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: surprisingly good for the money (but not for a family room TV)
customer_reviews.text: Excellent computer monitor, deep blacks, really nice... Probably not great for a real TV as viewing angles are rather limited.. but if you're straight in line with it, its beautiful... Decent gaming (Racing and Flight sims for me -- and some strategy), probably not fast enough for First Person shooters twitch shooters. Not great for text, but better than expected. I run my windows with 150% UI size and that works pretty well, and it gets much better as you increase that zoom, so its a trade off clarity vs screen space. I kept a standard 1080 monitor on the side for when reading is critical... This main screen is for entertainment games and youtube, roku, etc. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Huge! Love it so far!
customer_reviews.text: Graduated from a 55" to a 75" TV and this thing is great for the price. It's a bit heavy at 105ish lbs but it's hanging on the wall and hasn't came crashing down. The remote isn't always responsive because you have to point it at the TV but so far that's my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Bedroom TV
customer_reviews.text: I've had no problems with this product, or with a larger version for the Living Room. My only complaint applies to all TV subscription plans that rely on an archaic remote control login procedure that requires one-letter-at-a-time registration. And then if you have two or more of these devices, you have a minor nightmare logging back in if they all lose your authorization. Horse and buggy in the space age. Can do better.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: 120hz CMI not true 120hz, but I can't tell & would happily buy again!
customer_reviews.text: The tv is awesome. Cant beat it for $300! Only reason I couldnt give 5 stars is because after doing a bit more research I found out about "fake" refresh rates. So apparently it's 120hz cmi which is not true 120hz. I guess its like a souped up 60hz that can produce 120hz to the eye (whatever that means lol). Regardless, I'm more than happy with the picture and have not noticed any motion blurring or anything like that. IMO this is a killer 50" smart tv for an absolute steal of a price! Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: RWMT

customer_reviews.title: Died after 7.5 months. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Picture pretty low quality - but for such a low price thats ok. Software features really good. Great remote. BUT this thing died after just 7.5 months! Thats just crazy. Just stopped turning on (screen stays black even though power light comes on). Going back to samsung. Will file warranty claim just to get it fixed before donating to goodwill.
customer_reviews.author: TDD

customer_reviews.title: Mounting stupidity
customer_reviews.text: why put 2 small screws in top, that I cant use? But nothing for bottom holes? I cant even get down to see if I can get a screw in there. But if I can, I have to go buy special screws. Is it so hard to go with the typical size screws for a mount? IS IT!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: andrew puent

customer_reviews.title: Good image quality
customer_reviews.text: Love the tv. (75”) Pros: It works. Picture quality is great and often larger than life size It is stable on the included feet Playing video games is a treat because now I read all the HUD stuff Cons: Doesn’t hook up to Google Home. The remote has shortcut buttons to streaming services, and it has one I don’t have and doesn’t have one I do. I didn’t think to measure the tv stand and had to get a new one haha You do have to enter a credit card at setup, but it’s just to have on file. As long as you don’t have kids that will accidentally buy things through the tv, it won’t be charged.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Two TV s  Broken
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could give it a "0". First one sputtered every few seconds with static and picture went black and white or disappeared. Sometimes it would go an hour without this. Got replacement. 2nd one is doing the same, though much less frequently. Had to wait a week between shipments. Company gives no instructions as to how to connect to the Dish, and technical assistance doesn't help much. I somehow found how to do it. I did get $25 refund and $25 purchase credit (for qualified Amazon purchases) on 1st TV. Is something happening in shipping? Now I have to go out to buy a TV, exposing myself to possible Covid-19 infection.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Great Resolution and Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED: Original review below. I received a reply from TCL about a brightness issue I was having. It was the only issue I was having and their response corrected the issue. It was a lack of knowledge on my end. Thanks TCL for a great TV for a great price! Original Review: Disappointed at the brightness of this TV. You only have the options of Dim, Normal, Bright, Brighter. Even on Brighter, the TV is nowhere near the brightness of any other LED TV I own. Everything else is great about this TV, just not able to see it very well in a brightly lit room. Maybe I received a lemon, who knows.
customer_reviews.author: BorgX

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer defect
customer_reviews.text: Like so many others. Manufacturer defect, dead strip. Happened a week after the Amazon refund policy was allowed. Poor product support and unable to get response from manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Maynes

customer_reviews.title: Beware - you need to purchase a Roku account to use this TV
customer_reviews.text: Nice picture but beware you will need to spend at least an extra $139 for a 2-year account to activate the TV or $170 for a lifetime account. This isn’t in the description so when you get this nicely priced TV you’re forced to spend more money on an account.😡
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Schwarz

customer_reviews.title: stopped working, wont power on- you get what you paid for, not good
customer_reviews.text: Beware: new update 5/12 after shipping back the repaired tv with a cracked screen i have been in a purgatory of endless back and forth emails. 4/24- the TV will not power on. Called support and they are swapping it out but its a process. Taking it off mount, removing mount and thank goodness I saved my box from 3 months ago. How this TV got such high reviews has me wondering. The only screen modification I can make is brightness and its not bright at all on max. NO customized screen settings. Volume does not get loud at all even at 100. I purchased this on reviews, how it got 4.5 stars is highly questionable. Stay away from TCL.
customer_reviews.author: Benedetto Franzoso

customer_reviews.title: Look no further for a TV.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have a single complaint about this tv. One of the best things about it, for me, is that it’s very light weight so you will have no problems mounting this to a wall. The base legs are very sturdy and secure. They’re also angled out a bit for better stability. I love this brand and find no reason to go with any other brand from now on. For those who left this tv a one star review because it arrived damaged, that’s the fault of the courier not the tv! Review the courier with your issues. Some people smh.
customer_reviews.author: A. A

customer_reviews.title: DATA CAP USERS BE WARE
customer_reviews.text: I just called Amazon , emailed TCL and roku. All 3 said there is no way to change resolution output on this TV. This is a fatal flaw if you have a data cap. If you stream 4k it is 7GB per hour. Now im forced to run a cable from the tv to my pc across the floor and control video playback from the PC to reduce data use this renders the "SMART" features of the TV useless.
customer_reviews.author: moslin

customer_reviews.title: Great price. Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: I've really enjoyed having my TV! Netflix streams very well. I added a Spotify app for music and that works great. I can screenshare with my Galaxy S9 and also connect via Bluetooth for several apps like Spotify and Netflix. I would suggest a sound bar for someone who wants the TV in a larger room. My room was about 133sq.ft. if I remember correctly, but my portable AC unit drowned out some movies and TV shows. Great tv for the price! I haven't been disappointed or had any problems since buying!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TV is a lemon
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this TV in late August. I've had to work so much that I haven't had a single opportunity to unbox and set it up till now in early October. After getting it hooked up to the internet I found that after it updates it just goes to this blank screen where there should be apps and ways to navigate to television. Those never appear. I've reset the TV four times to no avail. Amazon won't accept the return since it's been more than a month. Don't buy this TV. And if you do open it and test it immediately. Now I have to navigate TCL manufacturer returns. Wish me luck.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Mikrut

customer_reviews.title: Broke on its own after 9 months and warranty is trying to deny service
customer_reviews.text: It was great for the first 8 months. On month 9, the 3.5mm audio out jack broke on its own. The internal speakers won't work because the TV thinks there's still something plugged into the audio out. So now we have no sound unless we use Private Listen mode via the app. Warranty service is currently trying to claim "physical damage" is not covered in the warranty and linked me to the warranty PDF and site. There's the best part: THERE'S NOTHING IN THERE STATE PHYSICAL DAMAGE IS NOT COVERED!!! Only damage physically caused by shipping from the retailer is not covered, which does not apply to my case. DO NOT BUY ANYTHING FROM THEM!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K

customer_reviews.title: ROKU is garbage on this TV
customer_reviews.text: The software on this TV is really really hard to enjoy. Crashes all the time and the settings are horrible. Disney + keeps playing audio guides during movies. Had to install it and reinstall to fix it. Good image though if you can resist throwing a remote at it after dealing with the software.
customer_reviews.author: AZBaker123

customer_reviews.title: Glad I didn't destroy the box
customer_reviews.text: This was a black Friday purchase, great price... not so good TV. After I installed it on the wall and hooked everything up, it wouldn't recognize any of the HDMI inputs or sound bar. After talking to the manufacturers tech line, I was advised to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Good buy from Amazon, didn’t come damaged
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a tv in our bedroom and wanted to give this smart tv a try. We wanted the 55 inch but amazon only had the 50 inch available. We were so worried it would come with a broken screen but it actually turned out great. Worked on the mount we bought also through amazon. Clear pictures. Smart features are great. Has a built in Netflix, amazon, Hulu, Disney plus, bravo, and espn app. Hope it’s durable and last us 5 years!
customer_reviews.author: Viv

customer_reviews.title: I regret buying it. Daily issues makes me wish I spent the money on a brand name.
customer_reviews.text: Great picture, but the TV itself is slow, unresponsive, and constantly restarts itself. It is a daily mission to have the tv work properly. Runs all apps terribly, with constant crashes and delays in speech. Not to mention the control has to be in a near perfect line straight towards the front of the tv if you want it to work at all. Spend the money and get a brand name, because this one feels like a flea market knockoff. Would never buy again. If it wasn’t so cheap I would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Anette N.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, that's all I can say, don't even bother.
customer_reviews.text: This smart tv has the most stupid operating system ever, very hard to use, and the picture quality is zero, I regret buying it big time, total waste of money, I bought this for my motherinlow and this TV has been nothing but problem almost everyday, finally I dicsided to buy a Samsung and after that no more problems or what so ever, now everybody is happy, now I have this tv in the Samsung box and seance I leave in a apartment is sitting in my living room waiting to find somebody who loves this tv to give em half price for what I purchased, please let me know if somebody is intrested.
customer_reviews.author: Vrej Sarokhanian

customer_reviews.text: ONLY HAD THIS TV 6 WEEKS AND THE SCREEN KEEPS FLASHING WHITE LINES ACROSS IT EVERY 30-45 SECONDS. BOUGHT AN ASURION PLAN (THEY ARE WORTHLESS-CANCELLING TODAY) AND THEY WON'T DO ANYTHING. GETTING HOLD OF TCL IS LIKE PULLING TEETH. THE TV IS NOT WORTH THE MONEY, THE INSURANCE PLAN IS NOT WORTH ANYTHING, AND THE CUSTOMER SERVICE FROM BOTH IS SOME OF THE WORST I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED. I WILL NEVER BUY TCL OR ASURION AGAIN. ALL THEY WANT IS YOUR $$$. AFTER THAT, YOU CAN GO TO HADES
customer_reviews.author: kevin d kelleher

customer_reviews.title: Good Value But Watch Your Privacy
customer_reviews.text: I was led to this product by the review at Wirecutter.com. It was the value recommendation which is certainly true. Unfortunately the great price comes at a cost to privacy since the TCL Roku TV monitors what you watch and sells that info to advertisers. That's the as-delivered default. Fortunately you can turn off that monitoring via a privacy option in the settings menu. That said, monitoring of streaming services like Roku and Netflix cannot be turned off according to Wirecutter. So, privacy-conscious buyers beware.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Awesome picture, size and tons of app and enough ports to hook up all of the extras!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely LOVE this TV and it was such an amazing price. I wanted 4K and something not too massive so this fit the bill perfectly. It has pretty much every TV viewing app you can think of and we’ve connected Yamaha sound bar, cable box and gaming console and there were enough HDMI ports for everything. Also love that you can add apps and login to them via the Roku app on your phone so you don’t have to do the awful keyboard on screen login like on our last smart tv. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: This 4k TV exceeded all my expectations by far. By utilizing the direct ethernet connection and the built in Roku there was no need for an intermediate 4K box like the AppleTV. I was concerned that I might need to upgrade from my existing AppleTV unit, but it is completely unnecessary. The presentation of all content is greatly improved, and on 4K material the picture is most impressive. I absolutely love this television!
customer_reviews.author: Number37

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny! Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I've been using LG Samsung and vizio TVs and this time is the first time of me trying TLC and i gotta say.. this is worth every penny and it is better then vizio and LG it stands next to samsung and sony and for the price i say its better then both. Good job TLC keep up the good work.
customer_reviews.author: Kassem

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS TV OR THE WARRANTY.
customer_reviews.text: WE USED THIS TV MAYBE TEN TIMES. IT IS IN AN ENCLOSED ENTERTAINMENT CENTER AND ONE DAY WE TURNED IT ON AND THE SCREEN WAS BLACK WITH A SPIDER LIKE MARKING INSIDE. THE TV HAS NEVER BEEN MOVED, THERE IS NO DAMAGE TO THE TV, YET NO ONE WILL FIX THIS EVEN THOUGH I BOUGHT THE WARRANTY. THE TV SHOULD HAVE BEEN SENT BACK TO THE MANUFACTURE SO THEY COULD SEE WHAT WAS WRONG INTERNALLY INSTEAD OF BLAMING US FOR SOME KIND OF DAMAGE. THE TV WAS NEVER DAMAGED!!!
customer_reviews.author: GEANINE PREGEL

customer_reviews.title: Lip syncing nightmares
customer_reviews.text: Well this would have easily been a five star review until this past week. And after searching on the subject, it’s quite common - the lip syncing is off! And this happened shortly after we attached the antenna and soundbar. Defaulted to original settings, played around with audio tv settings - it’s still like watching an old time Godzilla film. I’ve also seen reviews with this model that the audio sync went off with the last system update. ??? I’ll update review if we get this resolved, but in a nutshell, it’s ok for video games or sports, but it’ll drive you bonkers with movies and tv shows!!
customer_reviews.author: WiscoMom

customer_reviews.title: Major connection issues. Bad software.
customer_reviews.text: Major connection issues. Randomly tv will fail to connect to internet at startup. Wifi and ethernet are both fully functional and working on all other paired devices. After scouring the internet I discovered this is a known software issue with these tvs. I have tried both wired and wireless connections, doesnt matter. So frustrating. Going to settings and forcing it to Check Connection will often jumpstart it, but not always. Sometimes I lose 10-15min just waiting for this piece of junk to do this very basic yet critical function. Dont buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Selvidio

customer_reviews.title: Very good price to quality compromise
customer_reviews.text: CNET's review is where you should go for picture quality know how. I'd say the picture is very good but not great. I almost did not buy this TV due to other's remarks on mounting difficulty/lack of standardization of VESA standards. Don't worry, it was super easy to mount. I used this one... WIFI works flawlessly. Haven't had a single "blip" in over a month of operation. I'm thrilled with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Super simple to set up, very reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: My first TCL and Roku tv. I usually go for high end however this is a 43" for a VRBO. It was super simple to set up, and Netflix works a treat. Tho I find the wifi drops regularly when watching the free channels, kicks back in and in the meantime the tv has moved you to a different episode. Odd. Maybe I am doing something wrong and honestly I am not sure the picture quality is as good as it could be. Love the handset tho, small and simple, resembles a mobile when coming to volume buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price but...
customer_reviews.text: Overall the TV is a good value in my opinion. My main gripe is that the audio is very bad. It has only 3 volume settings and they are not directly available on the remote. The highest volume is not loud enough for even a small room. Also, the headphone output on my set doesn't even work at all. I went ahead and ordered an optical to analog converter with remote volume. Too bad for this deficiency as it otherwise deserves 5 stars. I just hope the converter works... Update, I feel really stupid. The volume control is on the side of the remote and it works fine. I have updated my review. The headphone jack is still inoperative.
customer_reviews.author: Theerk

customer_reviews.title: You need a lot of patients in the beginning - poor documentation & default settings
customer_reviews.text: The manuafacturer chose a terrible default setup for out of the box. I was ready to return this after 5 minutes. The settings I needed were not easy to find. I still may return it, but I found better settings that vastly improved the default setup. I do not see how this TV earned a number one spot by many reviewers. I have a six year old TV with a significantly better picture & it is only 1920 x 1080, but it does have 240hz refresh. Wish I could say something really good here, but I was crushed by the trouble I had to get a decent picture. I will give it some more time before I decide to return
customer_reviews.author: Whit T.

customer_reviews.title: an excellent computer monitor
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my artwork workstation. I don't watch TV or play video games. The screens are really good. I use one to view my artwork and the other for coding. The setup, with my somewhat old GTX960 graphics card, was tedious. I could not get one of my GTX960 cards to work but another works fine (a different brand). A pair of ACTIVE Display-Port to HDMI converters and HDMI cables are necessary. The more subtle image adjustments are on menus that are rather buried but the manufacturer responded quickly to my question and I can make the adjustments I need. I'm going to buy another pair of these for a second workstation.
customer_reviews.author: Clive McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR BATHROOMS!!!
customer_reviews.text: When you download and install the app, it actually has a spot listed in the app to put the TV in the bathroom. Don't let the name fool you like i did. I've held off buying this TV for 6 months, until I just realized it's just a bedroom TV. With one wire, I can stream tv shows and movies from anywhere in the house, and xFinity has streaming to watch local channels. When I timed it today, it was 30 seconds delayed from live tv news. Thank you for making such a great TV.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J

customer_reviews.title: Useless t.v.. Came w broken remote. Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Remote does not work. Called amazon to replace. They told me to buy another remote amd they would credit me.. They said they would call no later tjan 12.26. Its 12.27 no call. Tv is useless without it. Since no custo.er service response..returning it. Stick to known brands with bettwr guest services
customer_reviews.author: Jabc

customer_reviews.title: Great quality TV. Remote must be pointed EXACTLY the right way
customer_reviews.text: This TV was inexpensive and has a wonderful picture. It also has great smart options, being a Roku TV. It works with every streaming service and has tons of channels (apps) you can install with ease. I like it very well indeed. My only bone is a minor one: the remote control only works if it is pointed exactly at the TV. Gone are the days when you can just point the remote anywhere or bounce it off a wall. I'm not sure why they decided to make it so directional, but I suspect it was done on purpose. Anyway, it's quite different from most remotes and takes a little adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: G. FarnsworthTop Contributor: Board Games

customer_reviews.title: Roku Smart TV is not Smart
customer_reviews.text: There is no sound volume control on the Roku remote control. All settings are managed by the Roku remote and sound has 3 basic settings that are fixed. No written instructions included so had to use the internet for info. This is a "dumb" TV that expects the general public to use their blue tooth or wi fi connected devices to add speakers for true sound. Returning this for a standard smart TV.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M

customer_reviews.title: I'D RETURN IF I COULD
customer_reviews.text: This TV has a great picture. That said, the remote is terrible and does not respond to commands over half the time. I find myself punching the arrow buttons or the OK button numerous times to get it to do what I want. When it does respond to a command, the response is slow. This is a 2019 TV. Surely the processor could be made as fast as that on my four year old phone - it's not! It has been a real disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: gofields

customer_reviews.title: Great budget TV, but with engineering flaws
customer_reviews.text: Great budget TV, but with some engineering flaws: While this won't apply to everyone, in my opinion there are a few engineering flaws on this TV. 1. The HDMI connectors are /really/ close together. I was unable to plug-in an Amazon FireStick 4k and also plug-in a regular HDMI in the adjacent port. My fix: use an HDMI extension cable for the FireStick. 2. The infrared receiver LED is located in the middle of the TV. I use a soundbar, which blocks the IR receiver and is troublesome. My solution: place blocks under the legs of the TV to raise it ~4", so it can receive IR signals from the remote.
customer_reviews.author: xaric

customer_reviews.title: Check this out!
customer_reviews.text: Placed my monitor/ smart TV outdoors. Location is protected sum what. The TCL monitor makes me wonder why folks with much smaller and less vivid displays use’um. I primarily use my TCL for outdoor patio enjoyment. This for the money spent, I can not even begin to complain. It is super simple to pay 4x the money for a TV but really? Why? I look like a hero with outdoor 4K at a 26 inch price. I did purchase a well made outdoor cover for protection (highly recommend) while not in use. Everything considered and for my application, seems kinda... Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.author: Your Brother Man

customer_reviews.title: Tape on the screen?!
customer_reviews.text: Really decent picture for the price, especially if you’re finally upgrading to 4K. When you’re unboxing though... they taped the protective film directly to the screen with fairly strong packaging tape. I was patient and slow in removing it without damage, but there’s someone out there that had their new TV break when attempting to remove the film. If the odds of breaking are 1 in 1000 (0.001% failure rate) and they’ve sold 2 million, then the tape has broken at least 2000 otherwise perfectly working TVs.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Halanin

customer_reviews.title: even the box it comes in is great
customer_reviews.text: was delivered by a local company probably contracted by amazon, so if you the tipping kind be ready i only had them unbox it with me to plug it in and confirm it wasnt dead so i laid $5 on each of them (five bucks for five minutes seemed fair) the tv is just like all others its good and its big too dont throw the box out if you might be moving in the next 5 years its too perfect for the device to toss it fit in there with the foam bracing and lid-clips just perfect and snug. you can flatten the biggest cardboard part would recommend
customer_reviews.author: M.U.T.Lee Bayer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful TV
customer_reviews.text: Only bad things which are not a big deal, the TV is very thin and feels fragile so be careful when moving it. I watch Netflix and I notice if your off to the side the picture is a tiny bit pix-elated. If your looking at it straight on the picture is gorgeous. I run everything through my laptop, haven't tried the ROKU yet. I also play Xbox, completely flawless if you like gaming. Overall it couldn't be much better. I gave it a four for the minor issues above but for the price point you could easily call it a five.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This is my third TCL Roku TV. I have a 32" for the bedroom, this 50" for the living room and a 43" for the basement. These TVs are very inexpensive and offer a great picture. The sound is good enough that I don't feel that I need a sound bar. The interface is very intuitive and I like that I can use the same remote for all three TVs. Seriously consider the TCL series of TVs before you drop 10x the amount of money on a Samsung, LG or Sony. Unless you're a highly demanding cinephile with excellent vision. For the average Joe, these are great.
customer_reviews.author: RVS053063

customer_reviews.title: Dead lines (full screen) of pixels after 2 months, seller refused to assist
customer_reviews.text: Great TV, for about 2 months. Then the pixels broke, huge green vertical and horizontal line, making an x where they cross. I called the company, first off the service was just terrible. I spoke with a supervisor and they said there's nothing they can do except send someone to my house to fix it at my expense. So they sell a crap product, then try to charge you two months after it breaks. Ended up leaving this one star and filing a BBB complaint to warn others of this nonsense. I'll be getting my money back using Amex's return protection anyways. They should have just accepted a return, only had it 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Not a good bedroom TV
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is great, as are the Roku features. However, this TV has a strange problem that others have mentioned too; which is that the screen, even when off, is still actually on and has a faint glow that can brighten an otherwise dark bedroom while you’re trying to sleep. Not just the white LED light “standby indicator“, which itself can be turned off, it’s the whole screen. Like it’s paused on a black picture. It’s unnoticeable under many circumstances, unless it’s a bedroom TV as mine is. It’s bright enough that we need to physically unplug the TV when we go to sleep. It’s annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Too good to be true
customer_reviews.text: Stopped connecting to wifi after 5 days for no apparent reason. Tried rebooting. Tried factory reset. Tried resetting wireless router. Tried resetting entire network. Tried changing wireless password to see if it was a special character thing. Tried disabling network ping in the super secret Roku configuration screen. Tried using another wireless network. Tried manually configuring a private network. I don't own a USB stick so manually updating firmware is not an option. I'm guessing either something on the wifi card is fried, or there is a firmware bug. Disappointing product that doesn't do what it promises.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: OVERRATED
customer_reviews.text: I really think this TCL TV is way overrated. I mean, yes it is nice .. but it's not that great as others say. It's says 4K HDR but really, I didn't see the difference with the old cheap Magnavox TV we had. We hooked up our PS4 and it was the same video quality features. So, I guess I could just say we got a good tv for cheap, but I could def live without it or would have probably purchased another tv. No "wow" factor for me. EH.
customer_reviews.author: REAZT

customer_reviews.title: Died After  Month!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this Roku TV good ratings for picture quality, smart features and remote control but.... it died on me after one month's use. Sound but no picture. Sent it back. I won't buy a Roku set ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Baregrass

customer_reviews.title: clear sharp pic
customer_reviews.text: Do not like the awkward remote. For the price it has a very good pic. Just starting to check out the roku features. I have a very slow & unreliable ISP (Frontier) & therefore don't know how much use I will get out of the features using the internet. Sound just ok, but that is to be expected. Will hook up to my own sound system soon. Not sure yet about how much use I will get from Roku as I don't watch movies (they are mostly trash & worse), but hope to watch some college sports. Again, trying to navigate Roku with the crummy remote will take a lot of learning. A PC is so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: sidehillman

customer_reviews.title: Not so Smart TV
customer_reviews.text: TV has a lot of "Smart" technical issues that cause it not to work. Cable company said it's a TCL TV issue. Called Amazon said not their issue. No refund after trying to return after first month of use thinking it was a cable issue. Despite using less than a month I missed refund "purchase" period by 15 days. Next I called TCL spent over an hour on the phone. Temporarily Smart setting fix but it always has to be reset. Then another time it won't work again. I'm losing over a thousand dollars. Not smart purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Worden

customer_reviews.title: Worked for Two Months
customer_reviews.text: This TV was great when it was working. After two months, quite suddenly the picture went to almost black. I immediately contacted the seller and decided to get the exact TV as a replacement. There is obviously no rush in getting me the replacement, which I find unacceptable. If a product is defective, and determined to be within two months of receipt, I feel it should be replaced as quickly as possible. I still have no replacement TV.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon T

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT TV!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This tv is amazing, I am a gamer and movie lover. This picture is so crisp and clear words cannot express! The sound is incredible lol my neighbor has asked if I could turn it down a bit and I only had it turned up to level 30! Set up was sooo easy. I couldn’t ask for a better tv, I definitely recommend this to anyone!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Tarosky

customer_reviews.title: 2 different tv’s...broken
customer_reviews.text: TV came absolutely busted to hell. Had to order a replacement. I’ll have to update my review once the replacement arrives. Not sure how the TV even got like this because the box was fine. *Update* Replacement was sent. Had it for about two months and the same damage lines are appearing on the screen. Not sure what is going on because the picture looked fine up until recently. The tv is attached to a wall mount and is never moved so I don’t know why the screen is now looking “cracked” again.
customer_reviews.author: VonDutchRudder

customer_reviews.title: Bad Information
customer_reviews.text: It was not anywhere in the explanation of the TV that I would have to pay an extra $99.99 to pay for a Roku account to even activate the TV. I feel violated that I could not even hook the TV up and it work with my Xfinity. I hate that I had to pay more just to watch what I already pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffbev

customer_reviews.title: My Dad cried!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this TV to get my parents out of the Stone Age. My dad took my old tv and was still using a dvr box thing. I just had to buy them something that actually works decently. My old mans birthday came up and I sent them this TV, set it up and wow. It made my dad cry. Super happy with the features and quality. I have a 60” Roku Hisense. The quality on this TLC is better even if it’s smaller. My parents are enjoying the new tv now. Works great with the xfinity app. Streaming quality is very hd. I’m kind of jealous. Might buy this brand again when I move again.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Not a good television
customer_reviews.text: The sound degrades to scratching and sharp screeching dial-up tone sounds about 15 minutes into watching anything on any app. Works through an external Google Chromecast though with the same streaming services. Currently stuck in a reboot loop where it restarts to the main menu and restarts within 30 seconds after trying to click around the menu.
customer_reviews.author: SDM

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 of these. One came completely damaged. Be sure to open, set up, and turn on and look closely for signs of cracking or damage. We returned back to UPS and were sent a brand new one within a few days. Besides that, these tvs are incredibly easy to set up and use. I would highly recommend them to anyone who does not have cable and just wants to plug in and watch!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Grignon

customer_reviews.title: Great TV
customer_reviews.text: Great TV for the price. I didn't buy this TV because it had a built in Roku, as I'm an Apple fan, but now that I cut the cord I've come to appreciate the Roku features. I can get the same features on my Apple TV, but it's very convenient that it's built into this TV. I even have the sound going to the sound bar via an audio optical cable. The only issue with the TV is that it can reflect light from a window, but other than that, I love it. I'll be buying the slightly smaller version for my bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Keith A. Kiser

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value all around.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, one of the primary reasons for purchasing this TCL - ROKU 43 “ TV is that it was just about the only one I could find that fit exactly inside the armoire in our bedroom. Another plus is that we’ve been ROKU users since it’s early days. We’ve used several of the various receiver- remote combinations that Roku has developed over the years. In our opinion, this TV is the best ever. Beautiful picture, very good sound, flawless connection and, YAY!! , finally, just one easy to use remote to operate it! And, yes, it also operates via ALEXA. All this, for an unbeatable price! 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Z.

customer_reviews.title: Picture very dim after less than two months
customer_reviews.text: TV worked fine until a few days ago. The picture has dimmed to about 50% the brightness. I’ve checked and tried all the settings but no improvement. I also unplugged it and restarted. Still no improvement. Very disappointed.

People complain about the size of the legs - they are the same as the other TV's in my house (Vizio and samsung) - those that complain about the quality of the picture - its way better than the emerson i have, and its right there with my Vizio.
